title: Counterintelligence Staff Officer

description: USARPAC G2 CI Staff Officer; United States Army Pacific, Fort Shafter, HI Counterintelligence (CI) Staff Officer, Operations Division, Deputy Chief of Staff (DCS), G-2, U.S. Army Pacific (USARPAC). Responsible for G-2 staff supervision, tasking, and direction of all U.S. Army CI and Human Intelligence (HUMINT) activities and operations throughout USARPAC. Serves as the CI Staff Officer for USARPAC G2 for all CI/HUMINT activities, and USARPAC Threat Awareness and Reporting Program (TARP). Served in multiple PACOM countries as J2X, Task Force Counterintelligence Coordinating Authority (TFCICA), and Assistant TFCICA for Bi-lateral and multi-lateral Theater Security Cooperation Program engagements and Joint Chief of Staff (JCS) exercises. Coordinates with PACOM J2, Joint Service, military service components, and national level intelligence agencies on CI issues affecting the USARPAC Force Protection and Homeland defense programs. Serves as the G2 action officer for U.S. Army Special access, Intelligence Oversight, TSCM, Badge and Credentials, and Force Protection Programs. Served as the overall responsible manage for review and approval for all USARPAC Intelligence Contingency Funds expenditures throughout the Pacific AOR.

description: Senior CI Special Forces Group Advisor; Group Support Battalion (GSB) Senior Warrant Officer Advisor; Military Intelligence Detachment (MID) Commander; 1st Special Forces Group (Airborne), Fort Lewis, WA Served as MID Commander, Senior CI Advisor, and Battalion Senior Warrant Advisor to the Battalion Commander. Chief of Special Forces Group (A) CI/HUMINT Section consisting of three CI/HUMINT Group Operational Support Teams (GOST) conducting conventional and unconventional operations throughout the PACOM and CENTCOM AOR. Responsible for all CI/HUMINT for a Special Forces Group and it’s subordinate battalions operating worldwide; planning operations; theater collections; predictive analysis and dissemination. Responsible for missions consisting of liaison, CI Force Protection Source Operations (CFSO), and strategic debriefing program. Assumed MID command for one year.

description: Senior CI/HUMINT Tactical Observer/Controller for the Army’s premier light, Airborne, Air Assault, and Special Operations Forces soldiers. Coaches, Teaches and Mentors over 200 CI/HUMINT soldiers, collectors, and operations in Brigades in preparation for deployment and operations in Iraq and Afghanistan. Provides doctrinal training and observations to the Senior Intelligence O/C and advised him on all CI/HUMINT Tactics, Techniques, and Procedures. Directs and supervises four CI/HUMINT Permanent and numerous augmentees O/Cs. Assumed duty as MICO Senior in his absence. Prepared and conducted over 30 After Action Reports annually.
